info.title: Prusa Connect API (Inferred)
info.description:
This is NOT official Prusa Connect API documentation. This is the result of manually reverse engineering the platform when developing the `prusa-connect-sdk-client` Python library. See <https://dcode.github.io/python-prusa-connect-sdk-client/> for full documentation.

## Authentication

Most endpoints require a Bearer JWT access token obtained via OAuth2 PKCE flow.

**OAuth2 Endpoints (on `account.prusa3d.com`):**

- Authorization: `https://account.prusa3d.com/o/authorize/`
- Token: `https://account.prusa3d.com/o/token/`
- Client ID: `MRHTlZhZqkNrrQ6FUPtjyusAz8nc59ErHXP8XkS4`
- Redirect URI: `https://connect.prusa3d.com/login/auth-callback`
- PKCE Method: S256

Once obtained, pass the access token as `Authorization: Bearer <token>` on all authenticated endpoints.

## Notes on Field Names

Many response fields use API-side names that differ from SDK model attributes. Aliases are noted in schema descriptions where observed.

tags.name: Platform
tags.description: Public endpoints for API version and application configuration. No authentication required.

tags.name: Printers
tags.description: List and inspect printers, retrieve supported commands, and access printer-local files and storage.

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description: Job history, job details, failure reasons, and the planned print queue.

tags.name: Files
tags.description: Team cloud storage: list, download, and upload G-code / firmware files.

tags.name: Cameras
tags.description: List cameras and retrieve or trigger snapshots.

tags.name: Statistics
tags.description: Per-printer usage and job success statistics over a date range.

BearerAuth.description: Prusa Connect JWT access token passed as `Authorization: Bearer <token>`. Obtain via the `PrusaOAuth2` authorization code + PKCE flow. Token claims include: `jti` (token ID), `sub` (user ID), `exp` (expiry), `sid` (session ID), `app` (app slug), `type` (token type), `connect_id`.

PrusaOAuth2.description: OAuth2 authorization code flow with PKCE (S256) against the Prusa Account identity provider. The `client_id` is `MRHTlZhZqkNrrQ6FUPtjyusAz8nc59ErHXP8XkS4` and the registered redirect URI is `https://connect.prusa3d.com/login/auth-callback`. Include `code_challenge` (SHA-256 of the verifier, base64url-encoded) and `code_challenge_method=S256` in the authorization request. Exchange the returned code for tokens at the token URL, supplying the original `code_verifier`. The resulting access token is then passed as a Bearer JWT to all Prusa Connect API endpoints.

scopes.basic_info: Read access to basic account profile information.
scopes.email_lists: Access to email list subscription preferences.
scopes.connect: Access to Prusa Connect resources (printers, jobs, files, etc.).
scopes.user_operations: Perform user-level operations such as team management.

LimitParam.name: limit
LimitParam.description: Maximum number of items to return.

TeamIdParam.name: team_id
TeamIdParam.description: The numeric ID of the team.

Pager.description: Pagination metadata returned alongside list responses.

from.description: Index of first item in this page.

to.description: Index of last item in this page.

NetworkInfo.description: Network configuration details for a printer.

SourceInfo.description: Information about the source of an action or resource (e.g., a user).

avatar.description: Avatar URL. Relative paths are automatically prefixed with `https://media.printables.com/media/`.

Owner.description: Represents the owner of a resource. Same fields as SourceInfo.

SyncInfo.description: Synchronization details for a file or resource.

Temperatures.description: Current and target temperatures for a printer. Returned nested under the `temp` key in printer responses.

FirmwareSupport.description: Firmware version and support information for a printer.

Tool.description: Represents a print head / extruder tool.

active.description: Index of the currently active slot.

JobInfo.description: Snapshot of the job currently running on a printer. Returned nested under `job_info` in printer responses.

CameraConfig.description: Internal configuration snapshot for a camera.

Camera.description: Camera device associated with a printer or team.

id.description: Numeric ID used for snapshot retrieval.

token.description: Alphanumeric token used for snapshot triggers.

Printer.description: Full printer object returned by `/app/printers` and `/app/printers/{uuid}`.

printer_state.description: Also returned as `state` in some responses. Falls back to `UNKNOWN` for unrecognized values.

firmware.description: Current firmware version string. SDK alias: `firmware_version`.

last_online.description: Unix timestamp of last online time.

CommandArgument.description: Describes a single argument for a printer command.

CommandDefinition.description: Defines a command that can be sent to a printer.

executable_from_state.description: List of printer states from which this command can be executed.

JobStatus.description: Status of a job. `FIN_UNKNOWN` is returned for unrecognized values.

JobFailureTag.description: Reason tag for a job failure or cancellation.

other.description: Free-text note when tag is OTHER.

CancelableObject.description: An object within a print that can be individually cancelled.

Job.description: A print job in the history or queue for a printer.

start.description: Job start time as Unix timestamp.

end.description: Job end time as Unix timestamp.

cancelable_objects.description: Also accessible as `cancelable.objects` in some response formats.

Storage.description: A storage device available on the printer (e.g., USB, internal flash).

PrintFileMeta.description: Metadata extracted from G-code / BG-code slicer comments.

FirmwareFileMeta.description: Metadata associated with a firmware (.bbf) file.

BaseFile.description: Common fields shared by all file types.

hash.description: SHA256 hash of the file content.

PrintFile.description: A G-code or BG-code print file.

File.description: A file in Prusa Connect storage. Discriminated by the `type` field.

UploadStatus.description: Status of an in-progress or completed file upload.

TeamUser.description: A user that is a member of a team.

server_url.description: Base URL for the authentication server.

avatar_server_url.description: Base URL for retrieving user avatars.

max_upload_size.description: Maximum allowed file upload size in bytes.

max_snapshot_size.description: Maximum allowed camera snapshot size in bytes.

max_preview_size.description: Maximum allowed G-code preview size in bytes.

afs_enabled.description: Whether the Automated Filament System (AFS) is enabled.

PrinterTypeParameters.description: Hardware parameter ranges for a printer type.

PrintingNotPrinting.description: Printer usage statistics: time spent printing vs idle.

MaterialQuantity.description: Printer usage statistics: material quantity consumed.

PlannedTasks.description: Printer usage statistics: planned print tasks over time.

xAxis.description: Time axis as Unix timestamps. SDK alias: `time_axis`.

JobsSuccess.description: Printer usage statistics: job success/failure counts over time.

xAxis.description: Date labels for each bucket. SDK alias: `date_axis`.

ErrorResponse.description: Standard error response body returned for 4xx/5xx responses. `code` and `message` are always present. `reason` provides additional context for input/validation errors (e.g. invalid path parameters on a 400) but is absent for auth errors.

code.description: Machine-readable error code. Known values: `BAD_REQUEST` (400), `UNAUTHORIZED` (401), `NOT_FOUND_CAMERA` (404), `NOT_FOUND_PRINTER` (404), `NOT_FOUND_TEAM` (404). Full enumeration is not documented.

reason.description: Additional context about what caused the error. Present for validation/input errors (e.g. `Invalid path parameter: printer_uuid`); absent for auth errors.

get.description: Step 1 of the OAuth2 PKCE flow. Renders the Prusa Account login page as an HTML document and sets a `csrftoken` cookie. The server embeds the full percent-encoded authorization continuation URL in a hidden `next` field within the login form. The `csrftoken` cookie value must be forwarded as `csrfmiddlewaretoken` and the `next` value must be forwarded verbatim to `POST /login`.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: OAuth2 response type. Must be `code` for the authorization code flow.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The OAuth2 client ID for Prusa Connect.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The registered callback URI. Must exactly match the registered value.

parameters.name: code_challenge_method
parameters.description: PKCE challenge method. Only `S256` (SHA-256) is accepted.

parameters.name: code_challenge
parameters.description: Base64url-encoded SHA-256 hash of the PKCE `code_verifier`. Must be generated fresh for each authorization request.

200.description: HTML login form. Sets a `csrftoken` cookie required as `csrfmiddlewaretoken` in the credential submission. The form (`id="recaptcha_form"`) contains hidden fields `csrfmiddlewaretoken` and `next` carrying the percent-encoded `/o/authorize/` continuation URL through the login chain.

Set-Cookie.description: Sets the `csrftoken` cookie used for CSRF protection on subsequent form submissions to `/login` and `/login/totp`.

schema.description: HTML document containing a login form with hidden fields `csrfmiddlewaretoken` and `next` (the percent-encoded `/o/authorize/` URL to resume after authentication).

SubmitCredentials.description: Pass the `csrftoken` cookie value as `csrfmiddlewaretoken` and the embedded `next` form-field value to `POST /login` to continue the flow.

post.description: Step 2 of the OAuth2 PKCE flow. Submits the user's email and password as a form POST together with the CSRF token from `GET /o/authorize` and the `next` continuation URL. On success without MFA the server issues a `302` redirect to `redirect_uri?code=...`. If the account has TOTP enabled the redirect targets `/login/totp/` instead.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Percent-encoded `/o/authorize/` URL including all PKCE parameters. Preserved verbatim through every redirect in the login chain.

requestBody.description: Form-encoded credentials and CSRF token. `csrfmiddlewaretoken` is the value of the `csrftoken` cookie set by `GET /o/authorize`. `next` mirrors the query parameter and is used by the server to reconstruct the redirect chain.

csrfmiddlewaretoken.description: CSRF token value from the `csrftoken` cookie set by `GET /o/authorize`.

next.description: The percent-encoded `/o/authorize/` URL forwarded from the login form's hidden `next` field.

email.description: The user's Prusa Account email address.

302.description: Redirect on successful credential verification. Without MFA the `Location` header is `{redirect_uri}?code={authorization_code}`. With TOTP MFA enabled the `Location` header is `https://account.prusa3d.com/login/totp/?next={encoded_authorize_url}`.

Location.description: Redirect destination. Either the `redirect_uri` with an authorization `code` parameter (no MFA), or the TOTP endpoint with the `next` parameter (MFA required).

SubmitTotp.description: When MFA is required, follow the redirect to `POST /login/totp` supplying the same CSRF token, the forwarded `next` value, and the 6-digit OTP code.

ExchangeAuthorizationCode.description: When MFA is not required, extract the `code` query parameter from the `Location` redirect URL and exchange it for tokens at `POST /o/token/`.

200.description: Login page re-rendered with a validation error (invalid credentials or reCAPTCHA failure).

post.description: Step 3 of the OAuth2 PKCE flow — conditional, only required when the account has TOTP MFA enabled. Submits the 6-digit one-time password together with the CSRF token and forwarded `next` URL. On success the server redirects to `redirect_uri?code=...` containing the authorization code.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Percent-encoded `/o/authorize/` URL forwarded from the `/login` redirect `Location` header. Must be preserved exactly.

requestBody.description: Form-encoded TOTP submission. `csrfmiddlewaretoken` must match the `csrftoken` cookie from the originating `GET /o/authorize` response.

csrfmiddlewaretoken.description: CSRF token value matching the `csrftoken` cookie from `GET /o/authorize`.

next.description: The percent-encoded `/o/authorize/` URL forwarded from the `/login` redirect.

otp_token.description: 6-digit TOTP code from the user's authenticator app.

302.description: Redirect to `{redirect_uri}?code={authorization_code}` on successful OTP verification.

Location.description: The registered `redirect_uri` with the short-lived authorization `code` appended as a query parameter. Extract this `code` and pass it to `POST /o/token/`.

ExchangeAuthorizationCode.description: Extract the `code` query parameter from the `Location` redirect URL and exchange it for tokens at `POST /o/token/`.

200.description: TOTP form re-rendered with a validation error (invalid or expired OTP code).

post.description: Step 4 of the OAuth2 PKCE flow. Exchanges the short-lived authorization `code` (extracted from the `redirect_uri` callback query parameter) for a JWT access token, JWT refresh token, and OIDC ID token. The `code_verifier` must correspond to the `code_challenge` submitted in `GET /o/authorize` (RFC 7636). Access tokens are valid for 7200 seconds; refresh tokens are valid for approximately 30 days.

requestBody.description: Standard OAuth2 authorization code token request (RFC 6749 §4.1.3) with PKCE `code_verifier` extension (RFC 7636 §4.5).

client_id.description: The OAuth2 client ID for Prusa Connect.

code.description: The authorization code extracted from the `code` query parameter of the `redirect_uri` callback.

code_verifier.description: The original PKCE code verifier (high-entropy random string) whose SHA-256 hash was sent as `code_challenge` in `GET /o/authorize`.

redirect_uri.description: Must exactly match the `redirect_uri` used in `GET /o/authorize`.

200.description: Token response containing a Bearer access token, refresh token, and OIDC ID token.

access_token.description: RS256-signed JWT Bearer token. Pass as `Authorization: Bearer <token>` on all authenticated Prusa Connect API calls. Decoded claims: `jti` (token ID), `sub` (account numeric ID string), `exp` (expiry epoch float), `sid` (session UUID), `app` (always `"connect"`), `type` (always `"access"`), `connect_id` (Connect-specific user ID string).

scope.description: Space-separated list of granted OAuth2 scopes.

refresh_token.description: RS256-signed JWT refresh token used to obtain a new access token without re-authentication. Valid for approximately 30 days. Decoded claims: `jti`, `sub`, `exp`, `sid`, `app`, `type` (always `"refresh"`).

shared_session_key.description: Session UUID shared across all tokens issued in this authorization session. Corresponds to the `sid` claim in both the access and refresh tokens.

id_token.description: RS256-signed OIDC ID token (JWT). Standard claims: `jti`, `sub` (account ID), `exp`, `aud` (client_id), `iss` (`https://account.prusa3d.com`). Extended `user` claim contains full profile: `id`, `email`, `language`, `first_name`, `last_name`, `public_username`, `avatar` (relative path), `avatar_small` / `avatar_large` (absolute media URLs), `external_service_ids` (`id_verse`, `id_academy`, `id_connect`, `id_shopsy`, `id_knowledgebase`), `otp_enabled`, `is_employee`, `is_staff`, `providers` (e.g. `["GOOGLE"]`), `department`, `custom_data`.

UseAccessToken.description: Pass the `access_token` value as `Authorization: Bearer <token>` on all authenticated Prusa Connect API endpoints (see `BearerAuth` security scheme). The token is valid for `expires_in` seconds; use `refresh_token` to obtain a new access token when it expires.

400.description: Invalid token request — malformed parameters, expired or already-used authorization code, or `code_verifier`/`code_challenge` mismatch.

get.description: Returns the current platform version. Does not require authentication.

date.description: ISO format UTC timestamp when this version was committed.

get.description: Returns public application configuration including OAuth2 parameters, upload limits, and feature flags. Does not require authentication.
Returns all known printer type definitions with hardware parameter ranges. Does not require authentication.
Returns all printers accessible to the authenticated user. Pass `team_id` to filter to a specific team.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Filter printers by team ID.

200.description: OK. May return either a wrapped object `{"printers": [...]}` or a bare array.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns printer groupings. Schema of individual group items is not yet fully documented.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns full details for a single printer by UUID.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns the list of commands supported by the printer. Used to determine printer capabilities before sending commands. The SDK requires `STOP_PRINT` to be present and raises `PrusaCompatibilityError` if missing.

200.description: OK. May return a wrapped object or a bare array.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

post.description: Sends a synchronous command to the printer. The command must be listed in the printer's supported commands. Known commands (no additional args): `SET_PRINTER_READY`, `CANCEL_PRINTER_READY`, `PAUSE_PRINT`, `RESUME_PRINT`, `STOP_PRINT`, `RESET_PRINTER`, `UNLOAD_FILAMENT`, `SEND_INFO`, `STOP_TRANSFER`, `SEND_STATE_INFO`, `RESET`, `DISABLE_STEPPERS`, `BEEP`.

kwargs.description: Optional named arguments for commands that accept parameters.

400.description: Bad request — invalid command or arguments.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns files stored on the printer's local storage.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns storage devices (USB, internal flash, etc.) attached to the printer.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns the job history for a specific printer.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns details for a specific job on a printer.

parameters.name: job_id
parameters.description: The numeric ID of the job.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

patch.description: Updates a job record. Currently used to attach a failure reason to a finished/failed job.

parameters.name: job_id
parameters.description: The numeric ID of the job.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns the planned/queued jobs for a printer. Response shape varies — may use `planned_jobs`, `jobs`, or `queue` as the key.

200.description: OK. Key name for the array varies across firmware versions.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns all teams accessible to the authenticated user.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns full details for a team, including its members (`users`) and invitees.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

post.description: Invites a user (by email) to join a team with specified permissions.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns all files stored in the team's Connect storage.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns metadata for a specific file in team storage, identified by its hash.

parameters.name: file_hash
parameters.description: SHA256 hash (or identifier) of the file.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Downloads the raw binary content of a file from team storage.

parameters.name: file_hash
parameters.description: SHA256 hash (or identifier) of the file.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

post.description: Creates an upload session and returns an `upload_id`. Follow up with `PUT /app/teams/{team_id}/files/raw?upload_id={id}` to send the binary data.

destination.description: Target folder path in Connect storage (e.g., `connect/My Projects`).

filename.description: The name of the file to create.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

put.description: Uploads the binary content of a file for a previously initiated upload session. Must call `POST /app/users/teams/{team_id}/uploads` first to obtain `upload_id`.

parameters.name: upload_id
parameters.description: The upload session ID returned by the initiate upload endpoint.

put.parameters_note: Additionally requires headers: `Content-Type` (e.g., `application/x-bgcode`) and `Upload-Size` (file size in bytes).

400.description: Bad request — missing or invalid upload ID.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns all cameras accessible to the authenticated user.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns the most recent snapshot image for a camera, identified by its numeric ID.

parameters.name: camera_id
parameters.description: Numeric camera ID (the `id` field on the Camera object).

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

404.description: Camera not found or no snapshot available.

post.description: Instructs the camera to capture a new snapshot. Uses the alphanumeric `token` field from the Camera object.

parameters.name: camera_token
parameters.description: Alphanumeric camera token (the `token` field on the Camera object).

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns notifications for the authenticated user.

seen.description: Unix timestamp when seen, or 0 if unseen.

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns time-based statistics on how long the printer spent printing vs idle over a date range.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start of date range as Unix timestamp (seconds).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End of date range as Unix timestamp (seconds).

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns statistics on the amount of material consumed by the printer over a date range.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start of date range as Unix timestamp (seconds).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End of date range as Unix timestamp (seconds).

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns time-series data of planned print tasks for the printer over a date range.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start of date range as Unix timestamp (seconds).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End of date range as Unix timestamp (seconds).

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.

get.description: Returns historical job success/failure counts bucketed by date for the printer.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start of date range as Unix timestamp (seconds).

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End of date range as Unix timestamp (seconds).

401.description: Unauthorized — missing or invalid Bearer token.
